column4: Q: I have connected D-Link DIR-615 to my network (home) and have managed to make it work under Windows.  Now, I am on my Ubuntu7.10 and am wondering how I have to procede to have connection in there too. Thanks (The security is set as WPA if it matters)
I'm trying to walk Rem through the same thing, he seems to have disappeared though...
I'll wait till Rem comes back but couyld you plz let me know when you start explaining, thanks
I was heading to the shower in a couple of mins. But I can help you first since Rem doesn't seem to be back yet.
thanks. i have a dsl connection and a d-link router working fine under windows.
pppoe yes
and just eth0
i forgot, it is a toshiba satellite laptop
I meant on the LAN side, you're runninga a dhcp server on the router which gives you an ip automatically in Windows?
i have dynamics IP
ok, then it should be pretty easy. Do you have a network icon in the sys tray? Then we can go through the GUI.
yes i have and i even tried to set up the wirelss connection manually
ok. Automatic settings (roaming) should work since you've got a dhcp server in the router. What ip do you get on eth0?
i tried roaming mode which didnt work but where do i see my eth0 ip (I have 192.168.0.1 which is the usual router)
when using roaming mode, which ip did you get? Which ip-range is the router set to hand out?
if i read it correctly: 192.168.0.196 to 199
ok. Did you get one of those or something else in roaming?
I am connected now, roaming did the trick, thanks a lot
nice! Glad I could help. =) What was the problem?
would you by any chance if net2go.com is safe enough to share files
i am not sure but i did the microsoft thing, rebooted ;)
no idea sorry.
aha =D
